newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Brent/Dubai narrows in Asia as Dubai spreads widen.
newsitem.headline: Brent/Dubai narrows in Asia as Dubai spreads widen.

text.p: The Brent/Dubai October spread was talked narrower on Friday as the Dubai intermonth spreads widened.
Traders said four wet October lifting Dubai cargoes were traded on Thursday which supported the Dubai market.
A U.S. major acquired three wet cargoes from a trader and two state oil companies at full-month quotes plus 46 cents, full month quotes plus 46 cents and full month quotes plus 47 cents.
A second U.S. major acquired a cargo from a trader at full-month quotes plus 45 cents, traders said.
The news brought the October Brent/Dubai into $1.79/$1.85 from a day-earlier $1.85/$1.95. Brent futures in London on Thursday firmed 52 cents to settle at $20.72.
Intermonth Dubai spreads widened out on Friday.
October/November was notionally talked 34/40 cents from 29/32 cents while November/December was assessed at 33/38 cents versus a day-earlier 28/32 cents.
Tapis paper quotes were steady with September bid at $20.95 but talked $20.90/$21.00 and October at 15 cents backwardation.
